verses.verse: For <WH113>, behold, the Lord, Jehovah <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635>, doth take away <WH5493> from Jerusalem <WH3389> and from Judah <WH3063> stay <WH4937> and staff <WH4938>, the whole stay <WH4937> of bread <WH3899>, and the whole <WH3605> stay <WH4937> of water <WH4325>;
the mighty man <WH1368>, and the man <WH376> of war <WH4421>; the judge <WH8199>, and the prophet <WH5030>, and the diviner <WH7080>, and the elder <WH2205>;
the captain <WH8269> of fifty <WH2572>, and the honorable <WH5375> man <WH6440>, and the counsellor <WH3289>, and the expert <WH2450> artificer <WH2791>, and the skilful <WH2450> enchanter <WH3908>.
And I will give <WH5414> children <WH5288> to be their princes <WH8269>, and babes <WH8586> shall rule over them <WH4910>.

And the people <WH5971> shall be oppressed <WH5065>, every one <WH376> by another <WH376>, and every one <WH376> by his neighbor <WH7453>: the child <WH5288> shall behave himself proudly <WH7292> against the old <WH2205> man <WH7034>, and the base against the honorable <WH3513>.

When a man <WH376> shall take hold <WH8610> of his brother <WH251> in the house <WH1004> of his father <WH1>, saying <WH8071>, Thou hast clothing, be thou our ruler <WH7101>, and let this ruin <WH4384> be under thy hand <WH3027>;

in that day <WH3117> shall he lift up <WH5375> his voice <WH559>, saying, I will not be a healer <WH2280>; for in my house <WH1004> is neither bread <WH3899> nor clothing <WH8071>: ye shall not make <WH7760> me ruler <WH7101> of the people <WH5971>.

For Jerusalem <WH3389> is ruined <WH3782>, and Judah <WH3063> is fallen <WH5307>; because their tongue <WH3956> and their doings <WH4611> are against Jehovah <WH3068>, to provoke <WH4784> the eyes <WH5869> of his glory <WH3519>.

The show <WH1971> of their countenance <WH6440> doth witness against them <WH6030>; and they declare <WH5046> their sin <WH2403> as Sodom <WH5467>, they hide <WH3582> it not <WH188>. Woe unto their soul <WH5315>! for they have done <WH1580> evil unto themselves <WH7451>.
Say <WH559> ye of the righteous <WH6662>, that it shall be well <WH2896> with him <WH398>; for they shall eat the fruit <WH6529> of their doings <WH4611>.
Woe <WH188> unto the wicked <WH7563>! it shall be ill <WH7451> with him <WH3027>; for what his hands have done <WH1576> shall be done unto him <WH6213>.

As for my people <WH5971>, children <WH5953> are their oppressors <WH5065>, and women <WH802> rule <WH4910> over them <WH5971>. O my people, they that lead <WH833> thee cause thee to err <WH8582>, and destroy <WH1104> the way <WH1870> of thy paths <WH734>.
Jehovah <WH3068> standeth up <WH5324> to contend <WH7378>, and standeth <WH5975> to judge <WH1777> the peoples <WH5971>.

Jehovah <WH3068> will enter <WH935> into judgment <WH4941> with the elders <WH2205> of his people <WH5971>, and the princes <WH8269> thereof <WH1197>: It is ye that have eaten up the vineyard <WH3754>; the spoil <WH1500> of the poor <WH6041> is in your houses <WH1004>:
what mean ye that ye crush <WH1792> my people <WH5971>, <WH1792> and grind <WH2912> the face <WH6440> of the poor <WH6041>? saith <WH5002> the Lord <WH136>, Jehovah <WH136> of hosts <WH6635>.

Moreover Jehovah <WH3068> said <WH559>, Because <WH3282> the daughters <WH1323> of Zion <WH6726> are haughty <WH1361>, and walk <WH3212> with outstretched <WH5186> necks <WH1627> and wanton <WH8265> eyes <WH5869>, walking <WH3212> and mincing <WH2952> as they go <WH3212>, and making a tinkling <WH5913> with their feet <WH7272>;

therefore the Lord <WH136> will smite with a scab <WH5596> the crown of the head <WH6936> of the daughters <WH1323> of Zion <WH6726>, and Jehovah <WH3068> will lay bare <WH6168> their secret parts <WH6596>.
In that day <WH3117> the Lord <WH136> will take away <WH5493> the beauty <WH8597> of their anklets <WH5914>, and the cauls <WH7636>, and the crescents <WH7720>;
the pendants <WH5188>, and the bracelets <WH8285>, and the mufflers <WH7479>;
the headtires <WH6287>, and the ankle <WH6807> chains <WH7196>, and the sashes, and the perfume-boxes <WH5315>, and the amulets <WH3908>;
the rings <WH2885>, and the nose <WH639> - jewels <WH5141>;
the festival robes <WH4254>, and the mantles <WH4595>, and the shawls <WH4304>, and the satchels <WH2754>;
the hand-mirrors <WH1549>, and the fine linen <WH5466>, and the turbans <WH6797>, and the veils <WH7289>.

And it shall come to pass <WH1314>, that instead of sweet spices there shall be rottenness <WH4716>; and instead of a girdle <WH2290>, a rope <WH5364>; and instead of well set <WH4639> hair <WH4748>, baldness <WH7144>; and instead of a robe <WH6614>, a girding <WH4228> of sackcloth <WH8242>; branding <WH3587> instead of beauty <WH3308>.
Thy men <WH4962> shall fall <WH5307> by the sword <WH2719>, and thy mighty <WH1369> in the war <WH4421>.
And her gates <WH6607> shall lament <WH578> and mourn <WH56>; and she shall be desolate <WH5352> and sit <WH3427> upon the ground <WH776>.
